instruction: In a large bowl, combine curd, ginger-garlic paste, nut paste, fresh cream, garam masala, turmeric, red chili powder, white pepper, nutmeg, mace powder, salt, and half of the fried onions.
title: Mix Marinade

transcript_segments.text: Add 3 tbsp ginger garlic paste, 300 g curd, and 3 tsp salt (adjust to taste). Mix the chicken pieces well. Now add the spice powders: 1 tsp turmeric, 4 tsp chili powder,
1 tsp pepper, 3 tsp coriander powder, 3 tsp cumin powder, and 2 tsp garam masala. Mix everything step by step to ensure the chicken is coated well with the masala.
Add whole spices: cinnamon, 12 cloves, 7 green cardamom, 3 black cardamom, 3 pieces of mace (javitri), 3 star anise, 3 marathi moggu, 1.5 tsp shahi jeera, and 3 bay leaves.
Add 2 tbsp onion-fried oil, 2 tbsp ghee, and 4 large chopped green chilies. Add one large bowl of fried onions (crispy). Add a small bunch of mint leaves.
Mint and coriander are essential for flavor. Massage the masala well into the chicken so it absorbs everything. Now add 2 tbsp fresh cream.
Add saffron milk with saffron strands, 1/4 cup sliced almonds, 1/4 cup chopped cashews, and 1/4 cup chopped pistachios. This enriches the Mughlai biryani and gives it a royal touch.

instruction: Add chicken or mutton pieces to the marinade. Mix well and let it rest for at least 1 hour, preferably in the refrigerator.
title: Marinate Meat

transcript_segments.text: The marinade looks rich and beautiful. Cover and let it sit for at least 2 hours (or overnight). For rice, take 1 kg whole grain basmati rice. Wash well and soak for 1 hour.

instruction: In a heavy-bottomed pan or handi, heat ghee. Add whole spices: cardamoms, bay leaf, cinnamon stick, and cloves. Sauté for a few seconds until aromatic.
title: Heat Ghee and Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: Boil a large pot of water. Add cinnamon, cloves, 5 cardamom, 2 star anise, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp shahi jeera, coriander leaves, and mint leaves. Let the water absorb the flavors.

instruction: Add the marinated meat to the pan. Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally.
title: Cook Marinated Meat

instruction: Cover and cook until the meat is tender and oil starts to separate from the masala. Add a little water if needed.
title: Simmer Until Tender

instruction: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add salt and optional whole spices (e.g., a bay leaf, cardamom).
title: Boil Water for Rice

transcript_segments.text: Boil a large pot of water. Add cinnamon, cloves, 5 cardamom, 2 star anise, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp shahi jeera, coriander leaves, and mint leaves. Let the water absorb the flavors.

instruction: Add soaked rice to the boiling water. Cook until 70% done (grains should still have a slight bite), then drain thoroughly.
title: Parboil Rice

transcript_segments.text: After 2–3 minutes, add the soaked rice gradually.
Add 3 tsp salt and the juice of 1 small lemon. This prevents the rice from breaking and keeps it fluffy. Cook the rice in two stages: remove some at 60% doneness for layering.
60% cooked rice will feel slightly crunchy. Remove it and set aside. Continue cooking the rest until 80% done, then strain and set it aside.
You can see the 60% rice — just firm enough. The 80% rice will cook fully on dum. Avoid overcooking.

instruction: In a thick-bottomed pan or handi, spread a layer of cooked meat with masala at the bottom.
title: Start Biryani Layering

transcript_segments.text: Now for the final step — layering. Heat a large pot on a tawa. Add 2 tbsp ghee and 2 tbsp onion-fried oil.
Once heated, add the marinated chicken pieces. Keep the flame high. Close the pot for 2–3 minutes to get the heat going. The chicken is starting to cook.

instruction: Spread a layer of parboiled rice evenly over the meat layer.
title: Add Rice Layer

transcript_segments.text: Now add the first layer: 60% cooked rice. Spread evenly. Add fried onions, coriander, mint, and 1 tsp ghee.

instruction: Drizzle the saffron-infused milk, rose water, and kewra water over the rice.
title: Add Aromatics

transcript_segments.text: Drizzle saffron water. Add the second layer: 80% cooked rice. Spread evenly. Add 2 tsp ghee, more saffron water, and fried onions on top.

instruction: Sprinkle chopped mint leaves, coriander leaves, and the remaining fried onions on top.
title: Add Herbs and Onions

transcript_segments.text: Add coriander and mint. Cover with foil. If no foil, seal edges with dough. Keep the flame high and place a lid. Let it cook on dum for 45 minutes.

instruction: Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid or seal with dough to trap the steam.
title: Seal the Pot

transcript_segments.text: Add coriander and mint. Cover with foil. If no foil, seal edges with dough. Keep the flame high and place a lid. Let it cook on dum for 45 minutes.

instruction: Cook on low heat for 20–25 minutes to allow flavors to meld using the traditional 'dum' method.
title: Dum Cook the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: Add coriander and mint. Cover with foil. If no foil, seal edges with dough. Keep the flame high and place a lid. Let it cook on dum for 45 minutes.

instruction: Let the biryani rest for 5–10 minutes after turning off the heat before opening the lid.
title: Rest Before Serving

transcript_segments.text: After 45 minutes, remove the foil. The aroma is incredible! Look at that beautiful biryani — chicken is soft and perfectly cooked.

instruction: Gently mix the layers before serving to preserve texture. Serve hot with raita or salan.
title: Serve Mughlai Biryani

transcript_segments.text: Before serving, mix gently from the bottom without breaking the rice. Look at the color, texture, and perfectly cooked rice and chicken. Serve with raita and boiled eggs.
